page.title: 05Transport
page.content: Tayport was a transport centre, it grew from the ancient{ferry}across the river Tay,which was one of the most popular and safest on the river, Macduff,thane of Fife, is said to have crossed the firth by this ferry when he escaped from{Macbeths}court to England. The fare for one person was 2d which in our money would be five sixths of one pence. A small passenger steam ferry boat plied on the passage and it was bought by the railway company when the railway came to Tayport. {Trains}used to carry the goods from Tayports factories to other places,but when the railway was closed down the factories suffered because there was no transport to carry the goods to other places.
